overview:
Founder and managing director of PNC (http://pnc.co.uk).

Gordon Tees left his position as Systems Manager at Goldman Sachs to found PNC (then Premier Networks Consulting Ltd) in 1992. PNC supplied cutting-edge technology solutions into the Banking and Financial sector. They won Deloitte’s Fast 50 Award (http://www.deloitte.co.uk/fast50filter/) two years in a row in 1997 and 1998.

Gordon Tees sold his controlling stake in PNC (by then PNC UK plc) in 2001 and joined Lehman Brothers where he focused on new business opportunities in open source technology and the internet.

In 2010, Gordon Tees once again became Managing Director of PNC (http://pnc.co.uk) and is spearheading their move into transactional database-driven websites and mobile applications, primarily using a platform of open source technologies.
